body:
@momoa16 Thanks for reporting this issue. I was able to reproduce the error. Can you try installing a development version of mlflow from the master branch and check if it works?

```
pip install git+https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow.git
```

This issue should be fixed by https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/5703, which converts `env_manager` to a plain string.

The error disappeared with the version on git (mlflow==1.25.2.dev0) with "--env-manager local"
If no --env-manager is specified execution fails with error --env-manager is "" expecting local or conda.

Command:
```
%sh

echo -e "[DEFAULT]\nhost = https://XYZ.azuredatabricks.net/\ntoken = MyToken\njobs-api-version = 2.1" > ~/.databrickscfg

MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI=databricks 

mlflow run https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow-example.git -P alpha=5.0 --experiment-id 1234567890 --backend databricks --backend-config  "{\"spark_version\": \"9.1.x-cpu-ml-scala2.12\", \"spark_conf\" : { \"spark.databricks.passthrough.enabled\": true },  \"num_workers\": 1, \"policy_id\":\"9999999999999\", \"autoscale\": {\"min_workers\": 1, \"max_workers\": 4} }" `

Here's the error message:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/databricks/python3/bin/mlflow", line 8, in <module>
    sys.exit(cli())
  File "/databricks/python3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 829, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/databricks/python3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 782, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/databricks/python3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1257, in invoke
    sub_ctx = cmd.make_context(cmd_name, args, parent=ctx)
  File "/databricks/python3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 700, in make_context
    self.parse_args(ctx, args)
  File "/databricks/python3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1048, in parse_args
    value, args = param.handle_parse_result(ctx, opts, args)
  File "/databricks/python3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1630, in handle_parse_result
    value = invoke_param_callback(self.callback, ctx, self, value)
  File "/databricks/python3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/click/core.py", line 123, in invoke_param_callback
    return callback(ctx, param, value)
  File "/databricks/python3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/utils/cli_args.py", line 82, in _resolve_env_manager
    return _EnvManager.from_string(value)
  File "/databricks/python3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/mlflow/utils/environment.py", line 31, in from_string
    raise ValueError(f"Expected one of {allowed_values} but got '{value}'")
ValueError: Expected one of ['local', 'conda'] but got ''''
```

@momoa16 I was able to reproduce a similar error by specifying `--env-manager ""`, but you don't use `--env-manager` at all, right?

```
$ mlflow run https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow-example.git -P alpha=5.0 --env-manager ''

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/bin/mlflow", line 33, in <module>
    sys.exit(load_entry_point('mlflow', 'console_scripts', 'mlflow')())
  File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1130, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1055, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1655, in invoke
    sub_ctx = cmd.make_context(cmd_name, args, parent=ctx)
  File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 920, in make_context
    self.parse_args(ctx, args)
  File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 1378, in parse_args
    value, args = param.handle_parse_result(ctx, opts, args)
  File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 2360, in handle_parse_result
    value = self.process_value(ctx, value)
  File "/home/haru/miniconda3/envs/mlflow-dev-env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 2322, in process_value
    value = self.callback(ctx, self, value)
  File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/utils/cli_args.py", line 82, in _resolve_env_manager
    return _EnvManager.from_string(value)
  File "/home/haru/Desktop/repositories/mlflow/mlflow/utils/environment.py", line 31, in from_string
    raise ValueError(f"Expected one of {allowed_values} but got '{value}'")
ValueError: Expected one of ['local', 'conda'] but got ''
```
Yes, I wasn't using --env-manager at all, expecting conda to be used as default as specified in https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/cli.html#mlflow-run,  "If unspecified, default to conda"
@momoa16 Did you get the error right after running `mlflow run`?

I'm getting the error from the cluster newly spun. Here's the standard output (The Standard error is in my previous message):

I was able to reproduce the error. Investigating what's causing this error.

Identified the root cause. When `--env-mangaer` is unspecified, `mlflow_run_arr` looks like `[..., "--env-manager", "''"]` because `env_manager` is `None` and `shlex_quote(None)` returns `''`:

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/d9058fcddb47f473dacd6435f4b4fa96c370935b/mlflow/projects/databricks.py#L330-L344
